intro: Grewia tsiandrensis, commonly known as the Madagascar sour fig, is a deciduous shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers and red, fleshy fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is edible, though it has a tart flavor and is often used in local cuisines.
